reviews.review_msg: Steve-o rules. Sure he might think BUS374 is a load (as any intelligent business student should) and it might show in his effort, but I doubt any prof could make this nonsense (OB round 2) any more interesting. The presentations were fun too. Plus, if you were in his shoes, wouldn't you wanna teach a low maintenance course like this?

Steve is an ok teacher. The class is relatively easy but the group project was a disgrace since it was the first time he was teaching this class he had no idea how difficult the project was. The material in the class was not very difficult and Steve did an ok job teaching it but he dosent go out of his way to help anyone.
The worst Professor in SFU. Save your money and take your class with someone else. Not at all helpful.
no comments / discouraging ...

While the course material was pretty useless, I felt that the group activities he designed forces you to develop some people skills. He's approachable, he's down-to-earth, and really puts effort into his classes.

This class was alright. I enjoyed going to the 2 hour organization meetings, mostly because I had a really good looking girl in my group!!  The activities were pretty fun while the final was all mc and fair. The T.A however marked the written section for the midterm really hard.

1 hour lecture and 2 hours of interacting with group (of 15-20 people), that is a typical class for 374. interesting resume at first, but as the course developed, it was obvious that the lecture was unless and the activities fun nevertheless useless; easy credit (not so much if you have a bad groupo), avoid if one actually wants to learn something

I really like this guys personality, he's really confident (not cocky). The course is pretty hard if you end up with a bad group, but the class was overall fun, it was kind of like The Apprentice with all the "organizational" activities... again unless u have a bad group.
You really don't know how to teach, and you're so cocky man
Poor communication skills and the prof is very disorganized
I'm sorry some people are just not cut out of teaching. Prof Busche is one of them. This class was terrible and a total waste of money. I don't recommend it to anyone if he's teaching it!!!
Don't have to go to lecture...just look at power point slides and textbook will be sufficient to get a good mark on test...
lectures are very interesting... if you follow. Paper is challenging as its requirements are vague. But depend on who you have as a TA.
Four tests (15%), one paper(%40)...10% show up to lectures

Unless you have an undying passion for org theory, this class is zzzzzzz....but good thing is that you can zzzzzzz.  Just memorize all the words on the powerpoint slides and A+ it like me.  I'm still wondering how I did it!
He knows the stuff very well. But quizes are not easy. In 1st quiz, he will ask what he said in the lecture. Quizes are quite tricky.
Lecture is totally non related to midterms!!!

Interesting subject(if like HR and org theory).Lectures are almost too informative.Although grading format is simple, you need to learn everything and in detail.A challenge. Reading (book/ppt), studying is not optional.Paper is super hard.
His exam are crazy, his ppt notes are useless. Paper are really really unfiar because of ther marker AVOID HIM !!!!!!!
The quizz is very hard.Unreasonable expectation.

The most useless and boring lectures EVER! Don't even attend it. Study all the text and PPT slides for the quizes and it will be easy like hell. Then some good writing in your case study should give you an A range.
Easy quizzes, no final. Study the LECTURE NOTES!!
No Comments
EASY!!  Lectures are useless, quizzes are easy, paper is easy.  What more can you ask for?
No Comments
No Comments
Study those pwt notes! Lectures are optional (aka skipable)
Good course, weird, but good...
even geeks are skipping
the only way you can fail the exams is skipping them
Useless lectures, most people didn't even show up. Bad TA. Super easy.
